member.name: T:Sias.TeachingTool.SPositionTeachingForm
member.summary:
Teaching form
This form is used to teach positions. It supports - X movements for any arms - Y movements for any Y/Z device - Gripper movement for Y/Z devices implementing the IGripperSupport interface - Rotation movement for Y/Z devices implementing the IRotationSupport interface In addition it supports a coordinate transformation e.g. when used in the layout editor the user can teach layout coordinates instead of robot coordinates.
The Idea behind the form is that it will work (display and store) with teaching coordinates (transformed robot coordinate) all the time. Only for moving the coordinates will be transformed into robot coordinates. Requested positions will be transformed into teaching coordinates immediately.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SPositionTeachingForm.Position
member.summary:
Sets the teaching position of the SPositionTeachingForm
Setting the teaching position overwrites the actual user input fields with the values from the teaching position.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SPositionTeachingForm.TeachingOffset
member.summary:
Teaching tool offset property
The teaching tool offset and the teaching tool factor are used to remap the teaching tool coordinates. E.g. to translate between worktable coordinates and robot coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SPositionTeachingForm.TeachingFactor
member.summary:
Teaching tool factor property
The teaching tool factor and the teaching tool offset are used to remap the teaching tool coordinates. E.g. to translate between worktable coordinates and robot coordinates.

member.name: T:Sias.TeachingTool.SStorePositionEventArgs
member.summary: This class defines the Store position event arguments: - The origin position. - The user position. - The actual robot position. . All positions are defined as teaching coordinates!

member.name: M:Sias.TeachingTool.SStorePositionEventArgs.#ctor(Sias.TeachingTool.STeachingPosition,Sias.TeachingTool.STeachingPosition,Sias.TeachingTool.STeachingPosition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SStorePositionEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SStorePositionEventArgs.OriginalPosition
member.summary:
Get/Set the OriginalPosition of the SStorePositionEventArgs
The origin position is the reference point to teach, given either at creation of by assigning The teaching forms position property.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SStorePositionEventArgs.UserPosition
member.summary:
Get/Set the UserPosition of the SStorePositionEventArgs
The user positions are the values in the upper edit filed line of the teaching form.

member.name: P:Sias.TeachingTool.SStorePositionEventArgs.ActualPosition
member.summary:
Get/Set the ActualPosition of the SStorePositionEventArgs
The actual position is the position where the robot axis are actually located. The positions are transformed to the teaching coordinates.

member.name: T:Sias.TeachingTool.STeachingPosition
member.summary:
Teaching position
This class represents a teaching position. It keeps coordinate values for X, Y, Z, gripper(G) and rotation(R).
